author: Felicia Schwartz
title: U.S. Permanently Reduces Staff at Embassy in Cuba
text:
WASHINGTON—The U.S. will make staff reductions at its embassy in Havana permanent, the State Department said Friday, as officials have so far failed to determine the source of “health attacks” against personnel stationed there.

Secretary of State Rex Tillerson had ordered most staff except for emergency personnel to leave the embassy in September. The so-called attacks, which began in late 2016 and continued on and off into the summer of 2017, affected at least 24 U.S. embassy officials or family members, with symptoms including...
